update.description:
Just addressing some confusing API. Speak up if you have better ideas for the names.

* Renamed `Factory` to `SdfEntityCreator` to avoid a common confusion that it was a reference to the [factory pattern](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Factory_(object-oriented_programming))
* We have parts of the API using the word **remove** and other parts using **erase** - I changed all to remove, but speak up if you'd prefer to change things the other way around.

This pull request just renames files and functions - nothing else has been changed.

---

Summary:

* `Factory` -> `SdfEntityCreator`
* `Erase` -> `Remove`
* `Erased` -> `Removed`
* `Erasure` -> `Removal`
update.title: [debt] Rename Factory and Erase

content.raw: Ah I hadn't noticed them! But I think when it comes to the documentation, using synonyms here and there help the discoverability of the feature. So I'll let this slip in for now, I may remove them on pull request #153 :grimacing:
content.html: Ah I hadn't noticed them! But I think when it comes to the documentation, using synonyms here and there help the discoverability of the feature. So I'll let this slip in for now, I may remove them on pull request #153

content.raw: Looks good to me! I noticed that there are a few comments in the code that still use the word `delete`. We probably don't need to be extreme, but just in case you didn’t notice and want to use the word `remove` instead.
content.html: Looks good to me! I noticed that there are a few comments in the code that still use the word delete. We probably don't need to be extreme, but just in case you didn’t notice and want to use the word remove instead.

content.raw: Renamed to `SdfEntityCreator` as we talked about IRL.
content.html: Renamed to SdfEntityCreator as we talked about IRL.

content.raw: I think in the ECS every "object" will need to be an entity, what kind of objects were you thinking, like C++ objects?
content.html: I think in the ECS every "object" will need to be an entity, what kind of objects were you thinking, like C++ objects?

content.raw: Is the scope of this class to create/remove other “objects” beyond entities?
content.html: Is the scope of this class to create/remove other “objects” beyond entities?

content.raw: I like `EntityCreator`, I think it's ok that it will also remove entities. I'll make the change.
content.html: I like EntityCreator, I think it's ok that it will also remove entities. I'll make the change.

content.raw: `Warehouse`? `Supply`? `CRUD` (and then we add the `R` and the `U`)? I'm out of ideas :cry:
content.html: Warehouse? Supply? CRUD (and then we add the R and the U)? I'm out of ideas

content.raw: I agree that a noun would be better, but I can't think of a word better than `Factory` :grimacing:
content.html: I agree that a noun would be better, but I can't think of a word better than Factory

content.raw: I fear that may be too similar to `EntityComponentManager`so it can become confusing :confused:
content.html: I fear that may be too similar to EntityComponentManagerso it can become confusing

content.raw: See the explanation for why we need a separate class [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/130/a-6-entity-graph-factory/diff#comment-89699243)
content.html: See the explanation for why we need a separate class here

content.raw: I like the naming refactor for consistency. I'm not 100% convinced about the `CreateRemove` class. Create\(\) and Remove\(\) sound like verbs, but we need something that sounds like a name. You probably thought about this before but is not possible to have these functions inside the `EntityComponentManager` class?
content.html: I like the naming refactor for consistency. I'm not 100% convinced about the CreateRemove class. Create() and Remove() sound like verbs, but we need something that sounds like a name. You probably thought about this before but is not possible to have these functions inside the EntityComponentManager class?

content.raw:
I'm now wondering if it would be better to use `Delete/Deletion` instead of `Remove/Removal`. The reason is that it would be nice to match the service, and Gazebo 9 used `entity_delete`. By the same logic though, the `~/factory` topic could be changed to `~/create` or `~/spawn`.

The API has changed enough that it probably doesn't matter if we break the old patterns, but it would be nice to be consistent from now on.
content.html:
I'm now wondering if it would be better to use Delete/Deletion instead of Remove/Removal. The reason is that it would be nice to match the service, and Gazebo 9 used entity_delete. By the same logic though, the ~/factory topic could be changed to ~/create or ~/spawn.

The API has changed enough that it probably doesn't matter if we break the old patterns, but it would be nice to be consistent from now on.
